title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
byline: President Emmanuel Macron has named close ally Sébastien Lecornu as the new French prime minister, 24 hours after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou as head of government.

title: No student will face injustice at Gampaha Wickramarachchi Uni – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the government will take necessary measures to provide solutions without causing any injustice to the student of Gampaha Wickramarachchi University of Indigenous Medicine.

title: Sri Lankans in Nepal reported safe – Foreign Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs confirmed today that all Sri Lankans residing in Nepal are safe, with no incidents reported involving them.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North Western provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: Electricity tariffs to increase by 6.8%?
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has proposed a 6.8% increase in electricity tariffs for the final quarter of 2025, according to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL).

title: 73 Sri Lankan pilgrims await departure at India–Nepal border: Foreign Ministry
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Kathmandu has provided an update on the status of Sri Lankans in Nepal amidst the ongoing situation, the Foreign Ministry stated.

title: Apple launches slim iPhone 17 Air, new AirPods & Watch — What you need to know
byline: Apple unveiled a new generation of the iPhone, including a sleek model dubbed iPhone 17 Air, and several other devices on Tuesday, as it looks to drive upgrades and spur sales ahead of the holiday shopping season.

title: No-Confidence Motion against Dy Defence Minister can’t be accepted in present form - Speaker
byline: The Speaker of Parliament today informed the House that the Motion of No Confidence submitted by the opposition against Deputy Defence Minister Aruna Jayasekera is not in order and cannot be accepted in its present form.

title: India extends Rs. 600M grant for new A&E Unit at Mannar Hospital
byline: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed for the construction of an Accident and Emergency (A&E) Unit at the District General Hospital, Mannar, and the supply of medical equipment to the unit, with grant assistance of LKR 600 million from the Government of India.

title: Owner of bus involved in fatal Ella crash arrested
byline: The owner of the bus involved in the recent fatal accident on the Ella-Wellawaya road has been taken into police custody, police said.

title: Ex-Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN), Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been further remanded.

title: Polish military accuses Moscow of ‘act of aggression’ after shooting down Russian drones in its airspace
byline: Poland’s military said early Wednesday that it had shot down drones that violated its airspace during a Russian attack on neighboring Ukraine, the first time it has taken such a step in what is a major provocation for Europe and NATO forces.

title: 73 Sri Lankan pilgrims safely cross Nepal-India border
byline: UPDATE: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Ministry confirms that the 73 Sri Lankan pilgrims, who traveled to Lumbini by road from India, have safely crossed the border entering India.

title: SriLankan Airlines suspends flights to Nepal
byline: SriLankan Airlines announced that all flights to Nepal have been temporarily suspended until further notice.

title: Trump calls on EU to impose 100% tariff on China and India to pressure Putin
byline: Donald Trump has called on the European Union (EU) to hit China and India with tariffs of up to 100% to force Russian president Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill passed in Parliament
byline: The second reading of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill has been passed with a majority of 150 votes in Parliament, a short while ago.

title: Nepal Protests: Army urges foreign nationals to seek assistance if needed
byline: The Nepal Army has advised all foreign nationals who are stranded or require assistance in Nepal to contact nearby security personnel or authorities.

title: Owner of bus involved in fatal Ella crash granted bail
byline: The owner of the bus that caused the death of 15 persons in Ella, who was arrested for negligence in proper maintenance of the bus, has been granted bail by the Bandarawela Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sri Lanka expresses concern over recent strikes in Qatar
byline: Sri Lanka today expressed deep concern over the recent strikes reported in Qatar, which it says might further escalate volatility and undermine regional security.

title: Former Moratuwa Mayor Saman Lal Fernando arrested
byline: Former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Saman Lal Fernando has been arrested.

title: David Bowie archive with 90,000 items to open to public in London
byline: From glittery “Ziggy Stardust” costumes and handwritten song lyrics to fan letters and notes on an unfinished musical, a new archive of David Bowie’s life and career is to open its doors to the public in London.

title: SJB threatens to bring NCM against Speaker
byline: The opposition is prepared to bring a no-confidence motion against the Speaker of House, General Secretary of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Ranjith Madduma Bandara in Parliament.

title: Former Moratuwa Mayor Saman Lal Fernando remanded
byline: Former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Saman Lal Fernando, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) earlier today (10), has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Burning down the parliament and court a ‘great disrespect’ to Nepal’s democracy – Ranil
byline: Former President of Sri Lanka Ranil Wickremesinghe today expressed deep concern over the situation in Kathmandu, Nepal, condemning the recent violence and calling for the restoration of peace and stability in the country.

title: Speaker endorses the certificate on Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill
byline: Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certification on the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill which was passed in Parliament earlier today (10).

title: Nepal Protests: Kathmandu Airport reopens for civilian flights
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal has announced that Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport, Nepal’s main gateway, has reopened.

title: Sri Lanka made remarkable progress towards economic stabilization since the crisis: World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka has made remarkable progress towards economic stabilization since the crisis, the World Bank said in a statement.

title: ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowances to be credited on Friday
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board has announced that the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowances for the month of September will be credited to the beneficiary bank accounts on Friday (12).

title: Death toll in Nepal protests rises to 25
byline: The death toll in protests in Nepal against the government’s decision to block social networks and against corruption has risen to 25.

title: Rs. 500M allocated to upgrade science labs in schools across the country
byline: A financial allocation of Rs. 500 million has been set aside under the 2025 Secondary Education Sector Improvement Programme for the purchase of equipment and chemicals for science laboratories in 1AB and 1C category schools across the island.

title: SL committed to domestic accountability mechanism with technical support from UNHRC – FM tells UN Rights Chief
byline: The Sri Lankan government is prepared to pursue accountability for alleged human rights violations through a domestic mechanism, with technical assistance from the Human Rights Council, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has informed UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk.

title: Fire breaks out in a fuel tank at Sapugaskanda Refinery
byline: A fire has broken out in an empty fuel tank, which was being repaired at the Sapugaskanda Refinery, this evening (10), the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation said.

title: Appeals Court to hear petition filed seeking interim order against former Diyawadana Nilame Pradeep Nilanga Dela
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that a writ petition—which seeks an interim injunction to prevent former Diyawadana Nilame Pradeep Nilanga Dela from functioning as the acting Diyawadana Nilame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy—be taken up for consideration on September 23.

title: New circular issued for state school admissions
byline: A new circular has been issued regarding the admission of students from Grade 2 to Grade 11, excluding Grades 5 and 6, in government schools.

title: Online applications now open for jobs in Israel’s construction sector: SLBFE
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has announced that Sri Lankans can now apply online for employment opportunities under the fourth phase of the renovation sub-sector within Israel’s construction industry.

title: Appeals Court to hear petition filed seeking interim order against former Diyawadana Nilame Pradeep Dela
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered that a writ petition—which seeks an interim injunction to prevent former Diyawadana Nilame Pradeep Nilanga Dela from functioning as the acting Diyawadana Nilame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy—be taken up for consideration on September 23.

title: Israeli airstrikes in Yemen kill at least nine people, Houthis say
byline: At least nine people were killed and more than 100 wounded in Israeli airstrikes on Yemen on Wednesday, the Houthi movement said.

title: Card transaction facilities introduced to the judicial system
byline: As an initial step towards automating the payments made by the general public to the judicial system, card payment facilities have been introduced to the judiciary under the patronage of Chief Justice Preethi Padman Surasena this afternoon (10).
